My first night, it rained and I fell asleep listening to rain drops on a tin roof! The next morning, I enjoyed the sounds of happy birds as they dipped and dived in the nearby fields.
The cats are wonderful to watch and they are "besties" with the farm's fouls. But, it's the two working farm dogs I loved ~ they are friendly and will certainly greet you, but they are working to keep the farm animals (and guests) safe from the roving coyotes.
Kade and Ellen will make your stay absolutely perfect! Friendly, communicative, and just down right nice. Their family is simply darling and they go the extra mile just for you! Thank you so much for an awesome stay â¤ï¸

The king-sized bed was exceptionally comfortable and I my only regret was that I had to get out of it in the morning. The kids enjoyed the bunk beds, too. We were on a trip back home from a couple states west of KS but wanted a change of pace from the same trip out we'd made along I-70. It's 15 minutes (or less) from US-56, 83 & 160, so close enough to any highways you might be traveling, but far enough out that you don't have nosy neighbors.
